events.originalText: South Korean president Roh Moo-hyun walked across the Military Demarcation Line on his way to the second inter-Korean summit with North Korean leader Kim Jong-il.
events.subtitle: Roh Moo-hyun
events.headline: South Korean president Roh Moo-hyun crosses Military Demarcation Line for inter-Korean summit

events.originalText: A gunman killed five Amish girls before committing suicide in a one-room schoolhouse in Nickel Mines, Pennsylvania.
events.subtitle: 2006 West Nickel Mines School shooting
events.headline: Gunman kills five Amish girls in Pennsylvania schoolhouse

events.originalText: A maintenance worker's failure to remove tape covering the aircraft's static ports caused Aeroperú Flight 603 to crash into the ocean near Lima, Peru, killing all 70 people on board.
events.subtitle: Pitot–static system
events.headline: Maintenance worker's error leads to Aeroperú Flight 603 crash in Peru

events.originalText: A hijacked airliner collided with two other planes while attempting to land at Guangzhou Baiyun International Airport in China, killing 128 and injuring 71.
events.subtitle: Aircraft hijacking
events.headline: Hijacked airliner collides with two planes in China, 128 dead

events.originalText: Nguyễn Văn Thiệu was re-elected unopposed as President of South Vietnam.
events.subtitle: Nguyễn Văn Thiệu
events.headline: Nguyễn Văn Thiệu re-elected unopposed as President of South Vietnam

events.originalText: Thurgood Marshall (pictured) was sworn in as the first African-American justice of the Supreme Court of the United States.
events.subtitle: Thurgood Marshall
events.headline: Thurgood Marshall sworn in as first African-American Supreme Court justice

events.originalText: Second World War: HMS Curacoa (pictured) was accidentally rammed and sunk by RMS Queen Mary while escorting the liner to provide protection from submarine attacks.
events.subtitle: World War II
events.headline: HMS Curacoa sunk by RMS Queen Mary in accidental collision

events.originalText: President Rafael Trujillo announced that Dominican troops had begun mass killings of Haitians living in the Dominican Republic.
events.subtitle: Rafael Trujillo
events.headline: Dominican troops begin mass killings of Haitians, President Trujillo announces

events.originalText: The Shubert Theatre opened on Broadway with a production of Hamlet.
events.subtitle: Shubert Theatre (Broadway)
events.headline: Shubert Theatre opens on Broadway with production of Hamlet

events.originalText: Qing China signed the Treaty of Livadia with the Russian Empire, but the terms were so unfavorable that the Chinese government refused to ratify the treaty.
events.subtitle: Qing dynasty
events.headline: Qing China signs unfavorable Treaty of Livadia with Russian Empire

events.originalText: Mexican dragoons dispatched to disarm settlers at Gonzales in Mexican Texas encountered stiff resistance from a Texian militia at the Battle of Gonzales, the first armed engagement of the Texas Revolution.
events.subtitle: Dragoon
events.headline: Battle of Gonzales marks first armed engagement of Texas Revolution

events.originalText: As part of wider food riots, citizens in Nottingham, England, looted large quantities of cheese; one man was killed during attempts to restore order.
events.subtitle: 1766 food riots
events.headline: Nottingham citizens loot cheese during food riots, one man killed

events.originalText: With King Edward IV of England forced to flee to the Burgundian Netherlands after a rebellion organised by Richard Neville, 16th Earl of Warwick, Henry VI was restored to the throne of England.
events.subtitle: Edward IV of England
events.headline: King Edward IV forced to flee, Henry VI restored to English throne

events.originalText: The future King of England, Richard III is born at Fotheringhay Castle; in 1485 he usurped his brother's throne, denounced his nephews for being illegitimate and was killed at the Battle of Bosworth Field two years later
events.subtitle: Richard III of England
events.headline: Richard III born at Fotheringhay Castle, later usurps throne and dies at Battle of Bosworth Field

events.originalText: Scottish–Norwegian War: Norwegian and Scottish armies fought the Battle of Largs, an inconclusive engagement near the present-day town of Largs, Scotland.
events.subtitle: Scottish–Norwegian War
events.headline: Norwegian and Scottish armies fight inconclusive Battle of Largs
